metadata.correctionNote: 21 Jan 2026 - Major backfill from repository consolidation. 77 findings added. FND/Somatoform distinction clarified: FND Tremor WAS assessed (methodology disputed); Somatoform Pain Disorder NEVER assessed - this is the PRIMARY BREACH.

findings.title: Bulale 'Sleeping Pain-Free' Entry
findings.summary: Dr Bulale Ali recorded patient was 'sleeping pain-free' in September 2021. This directly contradicts documented inability to lie flat due to thoracic pain, which had been ongoing since October 2020.
findings.evidenceRefs: GP Record Sep 2021 entry; MSK Physio notes Aug 2021; MRI Nov 2022 confirming T5-T8 fractures
findings.legalSignificance: Demonstrates either failure to accurately document patient presentation OR deliberate falsification. Either undermines GP record reliability.

findings.title: 2020 MH1 Referral Contains Somatisation Framing
findings.summary: GP referral to adult secondary mental health services includes narrative stating patient presents with symptoms 'hard to explain,' references brother's suicide, and explicitly links to 'somatisation.' Exists as contemporaneous written artefact predating seizure/fractures by over a year.
findings.evidenceRefs: Core Adult Secondary Mental Health Service GP Referral Form (MH1) dated 28 Sep 2020
findings.legalSignificance: Demonstrates pre-existing documented 'psychological overlay/somatisation' narrative BEFORE key injury events. Critical for contamination pathway mapping.

findings.title: Neurology Letter Seizure History Divergence
findings.summary: Imperial outpatient letter documents seizure history as two witnessed episodes but does not clearly anchor the earlier episode as the 23 Dec 2021 tonic-clonic recorded in the ambulance ePCR.
findings.evidenceRefs: Outpatient Letter Dr Karunaratne 22/03/2022; Ambulance ePCR F250
findings.legalSignificance: Supports history divergence line - later documentation may have under-recorded or misdated the Dec 2021 seizure.

findings.title: Weaponisation of Brother's Suicide
findings.summary: Dorian Thomson died by suicide in 2011 after years of dismissed EDS chronic pain. Healthcare providers subsequently weaponised this family tragedy to justify psychiatric dismissal of John's physical symptoms, despite objective evidence of mechanical pathology.
findings.evidenceRefs: Daily Mail article 2012; F002 - MH1 referral; F040 - Somatoform diagnosis; Dr Gupta psychiatric assessment
findings.legalSignificance: CRITICAL - Demonstrates bad faith pattern, not clinical error. Using family tragedy to justify non-treatment aggravates quantum. May support aggravated damages.

findings.title: Dr Karunaratne 'Data Manipulation' Statement
findings.summary: NHS epilepsy specialist Dr Kushan Karunaratne verbally used the phrase 'data manipulation' when discussing GP care issues, with patient's parents present as witnesses.
findings.evidenceRefs: Patient testimony; parent witness statements (to be obtained)
findings.legalSignificance: Independent NHS specialist raising concerns about data integrity at former practice. Powerful corroboration of bad faith conduct concerns.

findings.title: Dr Gorrie 'Sketchy Stuff' Reference
findings.summary: Current GP Dr Alexander Gorrie verbally referenced 'sketchy stuff' that practice manager Clive Polles had done which blocked a recent practice merger.
findings.evidenceRefs: Patient testimony; context of merger failure
findings.legalSignificance: Independent NHS GP expressing concerns about former practice manager's conduct. Supports pattern of administrative misconduct.

findings.title: MSK Physio 'Attention Seeking' Documentation
findings.summary: Independent MSK physiotherapist documented: 'issues with GP, as they did not believe his pain and accused him for attention seeking' - PREDATES December 2021 seizure and fractures. Also documented 'pain not controlled since 2016.'
findings.evidenceRefs: MSK Physio records 04 August 2021 - Sumeer Bhamm, Charing Cross Hospital
findings.legalSignificance: CRITICAL EVIDENCE - Third-party contemporaneous documentation of GP dismissal pattern BEFORE major injury event.

findings.title: Ambulance ePCR Corroborates 23 Dec 2021 Seizure
findings.summary: London Ambulance Service ePCR documents a witnessed tonic-clonic seizure at home on 23 Dec 2021, including call/scene/hand-over timings, post-ictal confusion, and recovery to GCS 15.
findings.legalSignificance: HIGHEST-TIER CONTEMPORANEOUS EVIDENCE - Hardcoded timestamps from third-party source.

findings.title: Ambulance 5-Minute Response Confirms High-Priority Triaging
findings.summary: London Ambulance Service reached scene in 5 minutes (Call 22:39 → On Scene 22:44). This indicates Category 1 (Life Threatening) or High Category 2 (Emergency) triaging.
findings.legalSignificance: Objective third-party evidence that the index event was triaged as life-threatening/emergency. Contradicts GP characterisation as 'soft tissue injury'.

findings.title: ED Feb 2022 Confirms First Seizure Was 23/12/2021
findings.summary: Imperial ED discharge (18/02/2022) records witnessed tonic-clonic, diagnoses 'Tonic-clonic epilepsy', states 'first seizure on 23/12'.
findings.legalSignificance: HIGH-TIER - Hospital confirmation of first seizure date.

findings.title: Patient eConsult States First Seizure 23 Dec 2021
findings.summary: PATCHS submission (17 Oct 2023) explicitly states first tonic-clonic was 23 Dec 2021.
findings.legalSignificance: Seizure date documented in GP-held submissions, not retrospective reconstruction.

findings.title: Physical Examination by Jason Parry (July 2021)
findings.summary: RARE FACE-TO-FACE EXAMINATION: 'paraspinal muscle spasm... stiffness in lower lumbar spine... reduced core stability.' Confirms October 2020 pain onset and sleep disruption.
findings.legalSignificance: BASELINE - Documents visible physical signs 5 months before seizure. One of very few physical examinations in pathway.

findings.title: Pain Clinic Rejected Referral Without Patient Consultation
findings.summary: Independent MSK physiotherapist documented Pain Clinic REJECTED patient's referral because mother mentioned low mood/suicide concern. Patient was NEVER spoken to directly before discharge. 30 DAYS BEFORE the 23 December 2021 seizure.
findings.legalSignificance: CRITICAL - Demonstrates institutional decision-making without patient involvement. Shows patient was being REJECTED by services, not avoiding them.

findings.title: Dr Gorrie Removes Somatoform Diagnosis
findings.summary: Dr Alexander Gorrie marked the Somatoform Pain Disorder diagnosis as INACTIVE on 22 July 2025, noting 'there were clear causes for his pain.' Highly unusual to remove without formal psychiatric reassessment - error was self-evident.
findings.legalSignificance: CRITICAL EVIDENCE - Subsequent NHS clinician independently determined original psychiatric diagnosis was inappropriate. Internal vindication, not litigation-driven.

findings.title: Pain Clinic Refutes Somatoform
findings.summary: Pain Clinic explicitly disagreed with somatoform characterisation. GP record states: 'GP prev told somatic, pain clinic at C&W; felt not somatic.'
findings.legalSignificance: VINDICATION - Independent specialist refutation of GP diagnosis.

findings.title: 2019 Duplex Ultrasound Shows TOS-Positive Result
findings.summary: Bilateral upper-limb arterial duplex study recorded complete cessation of flow within the distal subclavian artery during Adson's and EAST manoeuvres bilaterally. Conclusion: 'Marked haemodynamic changes… a positive result.'
findings.legalSignificance: HIGH-TIER OBJECTIVE EVIDENCE - Vascular compression existed years before later disputes. Undermines 'no objective evidence / purely functional' framing.

findings.title: 2024 UCLH MR Reports Dynamic Subclavian Compression
findings.summary: UCLH MR thoracic inlet/outlet report describes compression of left subclavian artery and vein with arms abducted, including apparent focal stenosis.
findings.legalSignificance: HIGH-TIER IMAGING EVIDENCE - Objective vascular compression confirmed, reinforcing long-running TOS reality.

findings.title: Dr Gorrie Recognises 2021 Seizure/Fractures
findings.summary: Dr Gorrie (17 Oct 2023) recorded seizure history linked to MRI findings of T5-T8 'degeneration/old fractures'. First GP to properly recognise injury pattern.
findings.legalSignificance: VINDICATION - Demonstrates reasonable GP care would have identified issues earlier.

findings.title: US Doppler June 2025 Shows Dynamic Bilateral Subclavian Occlusion
findings.summary: Royal Free ultrasound Doppler documents dynamic vascular compression. Both arms at 90° abduction: subclavian veins 'compressed with no flow'. Right arm in Surrender position: both artery and vein 'compressed with no flow detected'.
findings.legalSignificance: HIGH-TIER OBJECTIVE EVIDENCE - Dynamic vascular TOS demonstrated. Establishes SIX-YEAR timeline of documented vascular pathology.

findings.title: CT Aorta April 2024: TOS Not Excluded
findings.summary: UCLH CT Aorta performed with arms down shows no stenosis in that position but explicitly states 'A thoracic outlet syndrome affecting left subclavian artery cannot be excluded.'
findings.legalSignificance: CRITICAL - Radiologist explicitly acknowledging TOS cannot be excluded with static imaging.

findings.title: Psychiatric Assessment Clearance
findings.summary: Psychiatric assessment by Dr Gupta found NO: PTSD, depression, psychosis, personality disorder, OR somatisation disorder. Presentation consistent with inadequately treated physical illness.
findings.legalSignificance: VINDICATION - Formal psychiatric clearance undermines somatoform labelling.

findings.title: Somatoform Diagnosis Applied Without Assessment
findings.summary: Dr Bulale Ali applied Somatoform Pain Disorder during a telephone consultation about switching opioid medication - NOT a psychiatric assessment. Patient was never informed. Applied AFTER MRI had proven T5-T8 fractures. Wrong ICD-10 code used (E278 instead of F45.4).
findings.legalSignificance: PRIMARY BREACH - Psychiatric diagnosis applied without psychiatric assessment, without patient knowledge, after physical pathology was proven. No responsible body of medical opinion would support this.

findings.title: 10-Month Fracture Diagnostic Delay
findings.summary: T5-T8 vertebral fractures from December 2021 seizure were not diagnosed until UCLH MRI on 16 October 2022 - approximately 10-month delay. Initial A&E assessment dismissed injury as 'soft tissue.' NICE NG59 red flags were present.
findings.evidenceRefs: A&E records Dec 2021; UCLH MRI 16/10/2022; NICE NG59 guidelines
findings.legalSignificance: PRIMARY BREACH - Failure to image and diagnose vertebral fractures despite red flag presentation.

findings.title: Pregabalin Reduction Contrary to BNF
findings.summary: Pregabalin reduced from 600mg to ZERO between 18-20 October 2021 without proper tapering protocol. BNF mandates gradual withdrawal. Occurred ~10 weeks before December 2021 seizure. See F369 for corrected details.
findings.evidenceRefs: GP Record Oct 2021; BNF pregabalin tapering guidelines
findings.legalSignificance: DIRECT BREACH of BNF guidance. Contributes to causation chain leading to December 2021 seizure.

findings.title: Pain Clinic Rejected Referral; Advised Psychiatrist
findings.source: ChatGPT session; upgraded with CL007 evidence
findings.summary: Pain Medicine correspondence states patient 'would not benefit from a referral to secondary care services.' Letter includes guidance re suicide risk referral to psychiatry. 10 weeks before December 2021 seizure.
findings.legalSignificance: CRITICAL - Pain service declining specialist intervention and routing toward community/psychiatric channels 10 weeks pre-seizure.

findings.title: Dr Morgan 'Opiate Addiction' Label Without Testing
findings.summary: Dr Sian Morgan stated 'main issue here is opiate addiction' with NO toxicology or formal addiction assessment documented. Entry includes misspelling 'opaite'.
findings.legalSignificance: BREACH - Addiction label applied without appropriate assessment. Defamatory label without evidence.

findings.title: Dr Drewry Entry References Brother's Suicide
findings.summary: Telephone consultation (18 Aug 2023) records disbelief of patient, frames brother's suicide as linked to seeking pain medication. Refused oromorph increase.
findings.legalSignificance: BREACH - Documentary proof of 'family tragedy weaponised' and credibility contamination.

findings.title: Dr Mehta Letter Documents GP Lamotrigine Titration Failure
findings.summary: Neurology letter (Dr Mehta, 19 May 2023) records patient's difficulties with GP following lamotrigine up-titration plan.
findings.legalSignificance: Independent specialist documenting GP non-compliance with specialist advice.

findings.title: ED Dec 2021: Back Pain Documented, Spinal X-rays Reported NAD
findings.summary: Imperial ED (24/12/2021) documents seizure AND back pain. Diagnosis: 'Pain in back; Seizure'. Investigations: X-ray (NAD) - fractures later found on MRI.
findings.legalSignificance: KEY BREACH - Back pain present at first presentation, X-ray modality missed fractures. NICE NG59 red flags present.

findings.title: MRI October 2022: T5-T8 Endplate Depression Confirmed
findings.summary: MRI 16/10/2022 confirms NEW T5-T8 superior endplate depression compared to baseline 20/01/2020. Somatoform coded 05/01/2023 was AFTER this scan proved physical pathology.
findings.evidenceRefs: MRI Report (Dr Yamamoto); Dr Simeoni letter 12/12/2022
findings.legalSignificance: CRITICAL - Baseline comparison proves NEW; 4 vertebral levels; Timing matches seizure; Somatoform applied AFTER pathology proven.

findings.title: ENT Letter June 2016: Pseudomonas Ear Infection
findings.summary: ENT clinic letter (07/06/2016) documents left otitis externa with pseudomonas, intermittent morphine requirement for ear pain, Ofloxacin drops.
findings.evidenceRefs: ENT letter 07/06/2016; Dr Sophie J Le Gros for Mr Hesham Saleh
findings.legalSignificance: Establishes ear pathology and quinolone use predating SCDS by years.

findings.title: ED September 2016: Acute Mastoiditis Diagnosed
findings.summary: Imperial ED (13/09/2016) explicitly records acute mastoiditis with ear discharge. IV Paracetamol, co-amoxiclav, naproxen.
findings.legalSignificance: VERIFIED MASTOIDITIS - Serious ear pathology requiring IV treatment. Predates SCDS by years.

findings.title: Recurrent Ear Infections 2016-2017: Severity Pattern
findings.summary: Multiple attendances June 2016 - November 2017: recurrent otitis externa, 10/10 pain, 80% hearing reduction, dizziness, opioid analgesia required.
findings.evidenceRefs: Adastra discharge reports; ENT letters; ED letters
findings.legalSignificance: Pattern of severe, recurrent ear disease over 18+ months - PREDATING SCDS.

findings.title: Sleep Deprivation → Seizure → Fracture Chain
findings.summary: Causation chain: Undertreated back pain → Inability to lie flat → 14+ months sleep deprivation → Lowered seizure threshold → Tonic-clonic seizure 23 Dec 2021 → T5-T8 vertebral fractures.
findings.evidenceRefs: GP records Oct 2020 onwards; Ambulance ePCR; MRI 16/10/2022; Jason Parry letter 22/07/2021
findings.legalSignificance: Establishes but-for causation: but for failure to treat pain adequately, patient would not have experienced seizure-inducing sleep deprivation.

findings.title: Post-SCDS Surgery Complications
findings.summary: C&W ED (06/02/2023) documents significant ear discharge/bleeding ~4 weeks after SCDS surgery at UCLH. Likely tympanic membrane perforation. Note: 'no notes available to access.'
findings.evidenceRefs: Post Skull Surgery Ear Discharge Summary 07Feb2023.pdf
findings.legalSignificance: Supports postoperative complication burden and inter-trust communication failures.

findings.title: Unusual Hours Record Access
findings.summary: Screenshots appear to show GP record access at unusual hours (weekends, bank holidays, late night) without apparent clinical justification. Pattern correlates with disputed entries.
findings.evidenceRefs: Screenshots (to be preserved); full audit log (via SAR)
findings.legalSignificance: If confirmed, may support UK GDPR breaches and/or Computer Misuse Act concerns.

findings.title: Clive Polles Mobile Phone Calls
findings.summary: Practice Manager Clive Polles made 'off the books' calls from personal mobile to patient's mother making claims about medication quantities. Claims are disprovable - father collected every prescription.
findings.evidenceRefs: Patient testimony; family prescription collection records
findings.legalSignificance: Non-clinical staff making clinical representations; Personal phone = no audit trail; Claims were false.

findings.title: Polles Refuses Replacement Patch (December 2021)
findings.summary: Practice Manager Clive Polles refused to authorise replacement buprenorphine patch (water-damaged) without clinical authority - ~4 days before December 2021 seizure.
findings.legalSignificance: CAUSATION LINK - Non-clinical staff making medication decisions that contributed to pain escalation and subsequent seizure.

findings.title: Early Hours Template Edits (17 Nov 2020)
findings.summary: Multiple 'Diagnosis Marked in Error' template entries show 'Entered' timestamps at 03:19 and 04:27 on 17 Nov 2020, associated with 'Unknown Staff Member'.
findings.legalSignificance: Supports need for formal audit trail disclosure.

findings.title: Date of Knowledge Analysis
findings.summary: Date of knowledge under s.14 Limitation Act 1980 is August 2025 - when patient discovered Somatoform diagnosis on record. s.32(1)(b) deliberate concealment also available.
findings.legalSignificance: Case is NOT time-barred. Limitation extends to approximately August 2028.

findings.title: Case Viability Assessment
findings.summary: Viability 55-75% with focused pleading. Two-lane strategy: Lane A (fracture delay) primary; Lane B (somatoform contamination) supporting.
findings.legalSignificance: Case is viable with focused approach.

findings.title: Credibility Attack Defence
findings.summary: 'Addiction' narrative neutralised by: (1) No toxicology testing; (2) Father collected every prescription; (3) Medications prescribed by Pain Clinic for documented conditions.
findings.legalSignificance: Defence against anticipated credibility attacks.

findings.title: Pain Pathway Gatekeeping via Unassessed Suicide Risk
findings.summary: Pain clinic denied secondary care using theoretical suicide risk while acknowledging NO risk assessment existed. Patient never seen before rejection.
findings.legalSignificance: BREACH - Procedural unfairness; care denied without clinical assessment.

findings.title: Modic Type 1 Changes Omitted from Pain Clinic Letter
findings.summary: MRI Lumbar (April 2025) revealed 'Modic Type 1 endplate change' (active inflammation at S1). OMITTED from Pain Clinic referral letter.
findings.evidenceRefs: MRI Report April 2025; GP Record 25 Apr 2025
findings.legalSignificance: SELECTIVE REPORTING - Objective inflammation evidence filtered out, likely influenced by somatoform contamination.

findings.title: Dr Drewry Oxycontin Cessation + False 'Lying' Accusation
findings.summary: Oxycontin ceased without taper; instructed patient to buy OTC Co-codamol. When patient followed instruction, GP later accused patient of 'lying.' Pharmacy records confirmed instruction was given.
findings.legalSignificance: BAD FAITH - GP issued dangerous instruction then blamed patient. Pharmacy records disprove accusation.

findings.title: Dr Arunachalam Lamotrigine Competence Failure
findings.summary: Anti-epileptic Lamotrigine 'deducted' from record. Dr Arunachalam refused reinstatement (28/09/2022) - 'could not see why it was started' despite documented tonic-clonic seizure history.
findings.evidenceRefs: GP Record 28/09/2022; GP Record 13/10/2022 (Dr Bulale restoration)
findings.legalSignificance: INCOMPETENCE - GP failed to link seizure diagnosis with standard AED medication.

findings.title: Dental Referral Age Discrimination
findings.summary: NHS dental referrals for severe malocclusion repeatedly rejected without notification. Rejections 'because patient is over 25.'
findings.legalSignificance: ADMINISTRATIVE NEGLIGENCE - Arbitrary age limits for functional deformity. Consider Equality Act complaint.

findings.title: Dr Morgan Pulse 100 Confirmation Bias
findings.summary: GP documented pulse 100bpm but instead of attributing to documented sinus tachycardia (since 11/08/2022), fabricated stimulant suspicion without testing.
findings.legalSignificance: CONFIRMATION BIAS - GP invented suspicion to explain physiological symptom; ignored 2 years of cardiac investigation.

findings.title: Suicidal Ideation Denial Documentation
findings.summary: Patient explicitly documented denying suicidal ideation on multiple occasions. Contradicts 'on the same path' narrative used to dismiss symptoms.
findings.legalSignificance: CREDIBILITY - Undermines defence argument that presentation was psychiatric.

findings.title: 2019 Royal Free Doppler: Vascular Investigation Pre-Dating Seizure
findings.summary: US Doppler Upper Limb Arterial 13/06/2019 - vascular investigation was underway BEFORE December 2021 seizure. Establishes continuity of vascular concerns.
findings.legalSignificance: TIMELINE - Vascular symptoms under specialist investigation years before GP dismissal. Six-year documented pathology timeline.

findings.title: Sleep Deprivation Causation Chain: Detailed Mechanism
findings.summary: Detailed but-for chain: Thoracic pain Oct 2020 → Inability to lie flat → 14+ months chronic sleep deprivation → Lowered seizure threshold → First tonic-clonic 23/12/2021 → T5-T8 fractures.
findings.evidenceRefs: GP records Oct 2020+; Patient testimony; Epilepsy specialist notes; MRI 16/10/2022; Ambulance ePCR F250; Jason Parry letter 22/07/2021
findings.legalSignificance: CAUSATION - Central to but-for argument. Expands F050 with mechanism.

findings.title: Cardiac Evidence Contradicts Stimulant Accusation
findings.summary: GP attributed pulse 100bpm to stimulant use (02/08/2023). Contradicted by: UCLH Holter 04/08/2021 mean HR 99bpm; Sinus Tachycardia diagnosis since 11/08/2022; Ambulance ECG sinus tachycardia 23/12/2021.
findings.evidenceRefs: GP record 02/08/2023; UCLH Holter 04/08/2021; Ambulance ePCR F250; GP Problem List
findings.legalSignificance: BREACH - Confirmation bias; ignored 2 years of cardiac investigation before stigmatising label.

findings.title: Addiction Diagnosis Without Toxicology or DSM-5 Assessment
findings.summary: GP documented 'the main issue here is opaite [sic] addiction' (02/08/2023) without: toxicology testing, DSM-5/ICD-11 criteria, documentation of addiction behaviours, specialist assessment.
findings.evidenceRefs: GP record 02/08/2023; Absence of toxicology; Pain Clinic correspondence
findings.legalSignificance: MULTIPLE BREACHES - FPM guidance, GMC Good Medical Practice, DSM-5 standards; defamatory label.

findings.title: UCLH Holter Monitor Documents Baseline Tachycardia
findings.summary: 24-hour Holter (04/08/2021): Mean HR 99bpm, Max 138bpm, Min 67bpm. Indication: 'Palpitations, collapses. Ehlers-Danlos syndrome.' Documented TWO YEARS before Morgan's stimulant accusation.
findings.evidenceRefs: UCLH Holter Report 04/08/2021 (16-page PDF); Ambulance ePCR F250; Pain Clinic letter 16/02/2022
findings.legalSignificance: DEVASTATING - Proves tachycardia was documented, investigated, and attributed to EDS/autonomic dysfunction before accusation.

findings.title: Mastoiditis History 2016: Baseline ENT Vulnerability
findings.summary: Severe mastoiditis September 2016. MED3 certificate issued (13-27 September 2016). GP noted: 'these issues are chronic... tinnitus and blocked sensation in middle left ear.'
findings.legalSignificance: BASELINE - Documented serious ENT pathology (not health anxiety); chronic middle-ear disease predating SCDS.

findings.title: Third-Degree Burn Without Sensation
findings.summary: Patient sustained third-degree burn with blistering from hot water bottle over 4-day period WITHOUT FEELING PAIN OR HEAT. GP documented but NO REFERRAL for sensory loss investigation.
findings.evidenceRefs: GP record 20/12/2023; A&E attendance; Patient photograph
findings.legalSignificance: BREACH + VINDICATION - Objective proof of neurological dysfunction ignored. Combined with bladder/erectile symptoms = cauda equina red flags.

findings.title: SECOND Burn Injury (September 2024)
findings.summary: SECOND hot water bottle burn September 2024 despite previous injury, again without awareness. 'once again had no comprehension it was evidently too hot.'
findings.legalSignificance: PATTERN - Two documented burn injuries from inability to feel heat. SAFETY RISK never investigated.

findings.title: Urinary Retention Episode (July 2021)
findings.summary: A&E June-July 2021 for urinary retention + back pain. MRI lumbosacral performed. Post-void residual 230ml. Patient 'unaware when he need to go to open bowels or bladder.'
findings.evidenceRefs: GP record 16/07/2021; A&E records; MRI Lumbosacral July 2021
findings.legalSignificance: BASELINE - July 2021 MRI was appropriate. BUT subsequent worsening should have triggered RE-INVESTIGATION.

findings.title: Post-Micturition Dribble (Onset May 2022)
findings.summary: Post-micturition dribble developed following vertebral fractures. Patient linked onset to spinal injury. Under specialist urology - Prof Drake attributed to EDS-related bladder dysfunction.
findings.legalSignificance: VINDICATION - Symptoms verified by specialist urology. Temporal link to vertebral fractures documented but not investigated.

findings.title: Erectile Dysfunction and Low Testosterone (Onset 2022)
findings.summary: 20+ months ED with no morning erections, zero libido, massive fatigue. Testosterone 4.0 nmol/L (severely low - normal 8-30). Treatment: Tadalafil 5mg.
findings.evidenceRefs: GP record 12/12/2023; Rheumatology letter; Urology records
findings.legalSignificance: CAUSATION - ED + bladder + sensory loss = sacral nerve root pattern. Should have triggered comprehensive neurological workup.

findings.title: Perianal/Buttock Symptoms Documented
findings.summary: GP eConsult (14/06/2024) documents 'Location of ailment: Buttocks and anus' with 38-month symptom duration (since ~April 2021).
findings.legalSignificance: DOCUMENTATION - Sacral-distribution symptoms. Combined with F119-F122 = complete cauda equina constellation.

findings.title: Spinal Specialist Discharge Despite Unexplained Symptoms
findings.summary: Spine specialist (08/02/2022) acknowledged MRI findings 'does not explain his severe back pain' but discharged to GP because 'no surgical target.'
findings.legalSignificance: CRITICAL - Specialist acknowledged unexplained symptoms but discharged. Subsequent evolution should have triggered re-referral.

findings.title: Pattern of Neurological Symptoms Never Investigated
findings.summary: Documented symptoms: urinary retention, post-micturition dribble, erectile dysfunction, two thermal burns from sensory loss, perianal/buttock symptoms, severe back pain. Despite constellation, comprehensive neurological workup NEVER performed.
findings.evidenceRefs: Aggregate GP records, specialist letters, patient photographs
findings.legalSignificance: BREACH - Failure to investigate progressive neurological symptoms. Once somatoform applied, red flags stopped triggering appropriate concern.

findings.title: Karunaratne Documents 14-Month Sleep Deprivation
findings.summary: Dr Karunaratne documented 'Has been sleep deprived for last 14 months' at first epilepsy assessment. Acute trigger 'Week running up to event had one night of no sleep.'
findings.legalSignificance: CAUSATION - Independent specialist documentation of the mechanism linking GP failures to index injury.

findings.title: Karunaratne Letter 2 Days Pre-Somatoform Documents Physical Symptoms
findings.summary: Two days before Somatoform applied (05/01/2023), Dr Karunaratne documented: 'Pain remains a major concern,' patient 'needs to prop himself against a wall' to sleep, MRI spine completed, skull surgery scheduled. No psychiatric concerns raised.
findings.legalSignificance: DEVASTATING - Independent specialist documenting severe physical symptoms immediately before GP applied psychiatric label.

findings.title: Karunaratne: 'Medical Explanations Found'
findings.summary: Dr Karunaratne explicitly stated: 'Rib and thoracic fractures have been confirmed' and 'medical explanations have been found for symptoms that he has been experiencing for a long time.'
findings.legalSignificance: VINDICATION - Independent NHS specialist confirming organic pathology. Undermines entire somatoform/psychosomatic framing.

findings.title: Karunaratne Documents Explicit Suicidal Ideation Denial
findings.summary: Consultant neurologist documented patient explicitly denied suicidal ideation: 'When asked frankly, he denied any suicidal ideation or thoughts of self harm.'
findings.legalSignificance: CREDIBILITY - Independent specialist documenting patient NOT suicidal. Contradicts weaponisation of brother's death.

findings.title: Karunaratne Formally Diagnoses Epilepsy
findings.summary: Formal epilepsy diagnosis: 'Epilepsy with generalised seizures.' Not NEAD (Non-Epileptic Attack Disorder). Lamotrigine 75mg twice daily.
findings.legalSignificance: VINDICATION - Final diagnosis is epilepsy, not functional/dissociative disorder.

findings.title: Telephone vs Physical Examination Dichotomy Pattern
findings.summary: SYSTEMATIC: Those who physically examined found pathology (Bhamm, Parry, Karunaratne); those who assessed remotely dismissed/fabricated (Bhaskar, Bulale, Morgan).
findings.evidenceRefs: CL007; GP Records; MSK Physio; Karunaratne letters
findings.legalSignificance: DEVASTATING - No responsible body would support psychiatric diagnoses without physical examination.

findings.title: Bhaskar Misrepresented Neurology Review to Deny Pain Care
findings.summary: Dr Bhaskar stated neurologists 'reviewed' patient with no back pain concerns. PROVEN FALSE - Kalladka's letter (2 days prior) was a TELEPHONE HEADACHE CLINIC that explicitly stated patient 'awaits pain clinic review.'
findings.legalSignificance: PROVEN MISREPRESENTATION - Bhaskar cited headache clinic letter as evidence about back pain to BLOCK the very review Kalladka anticipated. 10 weeks before seizure.

findings.title: Bhaskar Applied FND Label Based on A&E Mischaracterisation
findings.summary: CL007 addendum characterised July 2021 A&E as 'exacerbation of functional neurological disorder.' But A&E actually documented URINARY RETENTION (230ml post-void residual) - neurological red flags, not functional.
findings.legalSignificance: DIAGNOSTIC OVERSHADOWING - Used 'functional' framing to dismiss objective findings.

findings.title: Bhaskar Claim Limitation Analysis - ACTIONABLE
findings.summary: Bhaskar claim (October 2021) remains actionable. Date of knowledge: August 2025 (discovery of somatoform) or January 2026 (forensic comparison proving misrepresentation). Both within limitation.
findings.legalSignificance: Defendant: Imperial College Healthcare NHS Trust. Primary DoK Aug 2025 → Expires Aug 2028.

findings.title: SCDS Post-Surgical Imaging Shows Potential Residual Dehiscence
findings.summary: Post-SCDS imaging (8 months post-op) shows: 2 focal areas of potential residual dehiscence; Only 0.3mm bone coverage of sigmoid sinus; Bone cement encasing stapes.
findings.legalSignificance: Supports: future care costs (revision surgery), pain and suffering, loss of amenity (vestibular), uncertain prognosis.

findings.title: iMessage Evidence: Contemporaneous Family Communications
findings.summary: 50+ iMessage entries documenting pre-seizure family concerns, Clive Polles's direct involvement in clinical decisions, and contemporaneous awareness of psychiatric dismissal.
findings.legalSignificance: TIER 3 CORROBORATION - Establishes pre-seizure pattern of concern, documents practice manager making clinical decisions beyond authority.

findings.title: EDS Family History Documented 2011
findings.summary: 'Mother has EDS but not formally diagnosed' documented in 2011 rheumatology.
findings.legalSignificance: EDS family history predates current events by >10 years - not fabrication.

findings.title: Persistent Widespread Pain Since 2011
findings.summary: 'persistent widespread pain' documented 2011 - chronic pain predates current events by >10 years.
findings.legalSignificance: Undermines narrative that complaints are recent or attention-seeking.

findings.title: FND Listed in Problem List Without Assessment (Jan 2022)
findings.summary: 'Functional movement disorder' listed in problem list of ENT clinic letter despite patient never having been formally assessed for FND as of this date.
findings.legalSignificance: PATTERN EVIDENCE - FND label propagating through records without diagnostic assessment at this time.

findings.title: Third Window Symptoms/CT Findings (Jan 2022)
findings.summary: 'third window symptoms' identified prior to SCDS surgery - STRUCTURAL pathology.
findings.legalSignificance: Organic ear pathology predating surgical correction.

findings.title: Unable to Work as Illustrator (Economic Impact)
findings.summary: 'is an illustrator and unable to work at his normal baseline' - documented economic impact.
findings.legalSignificance: Establishes loss of earnings/earning capacity. Key for quantum calculation.

findings.title: POTS Diagnosis Explicitly Refuted by Cardiologist
findings.summary: Cardiologist explicitly states: 'You were previously labelled as POTS, but the test did not show this.' POTS was applied as a LABEL without confirmatory testing.
findings.legalSignificance: PIVOTAL - Demonstrates pattern of diagnostic labels applied without proper testing, later refuted when investigations actually performed.

findings.title: Autonomic Dysfunction Confirmed (Aug 2022)
findings.summary: 'an autonomic dysfunction with an anxiety exacerbation' - confirms objective autonomic pathophysiology.
findings.legalSignificance: Objective pathology confirmed - not purely psychological.

findings.title: Not Reviewed by FND Team as of Aug 2022 (TEMPORAL)
findings.summary: Dr Simeoni documented: 'Has never been reviewed by the FND team at St George's.' AS OF AUGUST 2022, patient had not been formally assessed by FND team despite FND appearing in records.
findings.legalSignificance: TEMPORAL EVIDENCE - Documents point-in-time status. The PRIMARY BREACH IS Somatoform Pain Disorder applied without psychiatric assessment (F040/F041).

findings.title: Pregabalin Cessation → Seizure Causation Documented
findings.summary: Dr Simeoni documented: 'When had a seizure pregabalin had been stopped abruptly.' Direct documentation of causal link.
findings.legalSignificance: DIRECT CAUSATION EVIDENCE - Specialist documents seizure occurred when pregabalin was abruptly stopped. Critical for clinical negligence claim.

findings.title: Baclofen 90% Effective for Tremor
findings.summary: Dr Simeoni documented: 'with 10 mg the tremor solves 90%.' Baclofen (GABAergic muscle relaxant) achieved 90% resolution.
findings.legalSignificance: CHALLENGES FUNCTIONAL TREMOR LABEL - Functional tremor would NOT respond to baclofen. 90% resolution indicates ORGANIC tremor component.

findings.title: GP Stopped OxyContin Unsafely - Seizure Risk
findings.summary: Pain Clinic explicitly documented: 'abruptly stopping oxycontin is unsafe as the patient is at risk of seizures and is at high risk of Withdrawal.'
findings.legalSignificance: DOCUMENTED SAFETY BREACH - In patient with known epilepsy, GP took action Pain Clinic explicitly warned was unsafe.

findings.title: 'Medical Explanations Found' - Vindication Statement
findings.summary: Dr Karunaratne: 'Today was the first time he sounded somewhat positive in a very long time. This is largely due to the fact that medical explanations have been found for symptoms that he has been experiencing for a long time.'
findings.legalSignificance: CORE VINDICATION STATEMENT - Direct specialist confirmation that symptoms attributed to FND/functional causes were actually organic pathology.

findings.title: Pain Referral Rejected Citing Suicide Concern
findings.summary: Dr Bhaskar rejected pain referral stating: 'if a patient is feeling vulnerable to the point of self-harm, I think it is not advisable to review this patient in the Pain clinic.' 10 weeks before seizure.
findings.legalSignificance: INVERTED CLINICAL REASONING - Mother's legitimate concern (informed by brother's death) was weaponised to DENY rather than enhance care.

findings.title: Secondary Care Deemed Inappropriate (Oct 2021)
findings.summary: Dr Bhaskar: 'I do not think this patient would benefit from a referral to secondary care services' - Specialist pain care denied.
findings.legalSignificance: Patient relegated to community management. Subsequently required multiple secondary/tertiary interventions.

findings.title: A&E Attributed to FND Without Assessment (Jul 2021)
findings.summary: A&E attendance (July 2021) attributed to 'exacerbation of his functional neurological disorder' but thoracic fractures later confirmed. Wrong area imaged.
findings.legalSignificance: Genuine spinal symptoms dismissed as functional. Wrong area imaged contributed to delay.

findings.title: Neurospine Discharge - Wrong Area Imaged
findings.summary: Mr Hassany: 'the MRI scan findings does not explain his severe back pain... no surgical target.' Patient discharged because LUMBAR MRI was normal. THORACIC spine (fracture location) was not imaged until 8 months later.
findings.legalSignificance: CRITICAL DIAGNOSTIC FAILURE - Patient suffered additional months of undiagnosed fractures due to imaging wrong spinal region.

findings.title: First Seizure Date Documented (Feb 2022)
findings.summary: 'one episode of tonic-clonic seizure on 23rd December 2021' - Documents first seizure date establishing timeline for pregabalin cessation → seizure causation.
findings.legalSignificance: Confirms seizure timeline. Pregabalin stopped December 2021, seizure occurred 23/24 December 2021.

findings.title: Rib and Thoracic Fractures Confirmed (Dec 2023)
findings.summary: Dr Karunaratne: 'Rib and thoracic fractures have been confirmed on a MRI scan.' Specialist confirmation of structural pathology.
findings.legalSignificance: 24-month delay from symptom onset (Oct 2020) to diagnosis (Oct 2022).

findings.title: SCDS Surgery 99% Successful (Dec 2023)
findings.summary: 'Following surgery at the Eastman dental unit, the eye symptoms are 99% better' - SCDS surgery achieved 99% symptom resolution.
findings.legalSignificance: Structural pathology requiring surgery - not psychological. Success proves organic cause.

findings.title: TOS Botox Treatment Planned (Dec 2023)
findings.summary: 'Botox intervention is planned for the thoracic outlet syndrome.' TOS (positive test 2019) now being treated.
findings.legalSignificance: Years of delay from positive test (2019) to treatment (2023).

findings.title: Epilepsy Stable on Lamotrigine (Dec 2024)
findings.summary: Dr Karunaratne: 'I am cautiously optimistic that the epilepsy is now under control as he is now on a therapeutic dose of lamotrigine.'
findings.legalSignificance: Confirms epilepsy is real (not dissociative) and treatable.

findings.title: Formal Epilepsy Diagnosis
findings.summary: Dr Karunaratne formally diagnosed: 'Epilepsy with generalised seizures.' Not functional/dissociative seizures.
findings.legalSignificance: VALIDATES CAUSATION - The December 2021 seizure was epileptic, not dissociative. Causally linked to abrupt pregabalin cessation.

findings.title: 'Dissecting Events of the Past' (Dec 2024)
findings.summary: Dr Karunaratne: 'We spent an hour in clinic today discussing various medical issues and dissecting events of the past.'
findings.legalSignificance: Suggests ongoing review and acknowledgment of past medical history issues. Potential supportive witness.

findings.title: Vascular Surgeon Lists Formal Diagnoses - Organic Conditions Confirmed
findings.summary: Vascular surgeon Mr Aaron Goh's formal diagnosis list includes: Epilepsy (NOT NEAD/FND), T5-T8 fractured vertebrae and ribs (confirmed), EDS/Hypermobility, Tremor of UNKNOWN AETIOLOGY (NOT labelled functional).
findings.legalSignificance: CRITICAL VINDICATION - Independent specialist (non-neurology) lists epilepsy and fractures as confirmed organic conditions. Tremor NOT attributed to FND - listed as 'unknown aetiology'.

findings.title: MRA Confirms Subclavian Compression and Stenosis
findings.summary: MRA imaging confirms 'compression of the subclavian vein on the left as well as a focal stenosis of the left subclavian artery' in the subclavicular space.
findings.legalSignificance: CRITICAL VINDICATION - Objective imaging evidence of TOS. Establishes 6+ years of documented vascular pathology (2019-2024-2025). Cannot be dismissed as functional/non-organic.

findings.title: Symptom Severity: Patient Would Prefer Amputation
findings.summary: Vascular surgeon documents extreme symptom severity: patient 'would rather his arm be amputated due to the discomfort'.
findings.legalSignificance: CRITICAL QUANTUM - Specialist-recorded statement establishes extreme suffering. Critical evidence for general damages assessment.

findings.title: Care Fragmentation Required Hospital Transfer
findings.summary: Care transfer required specifically to consolidate fragmented records: 'His care has been transferred from UCLH to the Royal Free in a bid to amalgamate his notes'.
findings.legalSignificance: Supports care coordination failure argument. NHS system required inter-hospital transfer to manage record fragmentation caused by care pathway failures.

findings.title: Psychological Attribution Carousel: Sequential Dismissals
findings.summary: GP practice cycled through psychological attributions over multiple years while ignoring physio evidence: Depression (2016), Somatisation/brother imitation (2020), Attention-seeking (2021), MH referral REJECTED (2020), Somatoform applied anyway (2023).
findings.evidenceRefs: MH1 Referral 28 Sep 2020; GP Entry 01 Dec 2016; MSK Physio Entry 05 Aug 2021
findings.legalSignificance: DEVASTATING BREACH INDICATOR - Practice cycled through psychiatric labels as substitute for organic investigation.

findings.title: Dr Bhaskar Rejected Patient From Pain Clinic Without Patient Contact
findings.summary: Dr Bhaskar wrote letter rejecting patient from Pain Clinic WITHOUT ever speaking to or examining the patient. 10 weeks before December 2021 seizure.
findings.legalSignificance: BREACH - Consultant rejecting chronic pain patient without assessment. Decision based entirely on GP's biased psychological framing.

findings.title: Dr Bhaskar Relied on Biased GP Referral About Wrong Spinal Area
findings.summary: Dr Bhaskar's rejection letter relied on MRI of 'lumbosacral spine' which was 'essentially normal' - but patient's pain was THORACIC. The thoracic fractures were never investigated because GPs only arranged lumbar imaging.
findings.legalSignificance: CRITICAL BREACH - Pain consultant accepting GP's lumbar focus when patient's primary complaint was thoracic.

findings.title: Dr Bhaskar Did NOT Recommend Pregabalin Withdrawal
findings.summary: Dr Bhaskar's letter explicitly states patient 'is currently on maximum dose of Pregabalin' with NO recommendation to reduce or withdraw. Letter recommends ADDING buprenorphine patch, not reducing existing medication.
findings.legalSignificance: CRITICAL - Establishes any subsequent pregabalin withdrawal was GP decision, not specialist recommendation.

findings.title: Williams Stopped 600mg Pregabalin Without Patient Consultation
findings.summary: Dr Williams stopped patient's 600mg daily pregabalin on 'Clinical grounds' but: No consultation with patient documented; No clinical reasoning recorded; Bhaskar did NOT recommend stopping (F367); Patient complained to Dr Idowu 2 days later.
findings.legalSignificance: BREACH CONFIRMED - Williams stopped high-dose controlled medication without documented patient consultation, recorded clinical rationale, or specialist recommendation.

findings.title: Williams Failed to Manage Pregabalin Cessation Despite Pharmacist Warning
findings.summary: TIMELINE: ~05 Oct: Patient self-stopped 600mg due to side effects. 08 Oct: Pharmacist McKenzie advised 'unwise to suddenly stop', recommended taper. 18 Oct: Williams formally stopped prescription entirely - NO taper issued.
findings.evidenceRefs: Entry 269 (McKenzie taper advice); Entry 271; Entry 288; Entry 291
findings.legalSignificance: BREACH CONFIRMED - When pharmacist documented unsafe withdrawal and recommended taper, Williams had duty to contact patient and issue taper. Instead, formally stopped prescription without management plan.

findings.title: Dr Idowu Entry Documents Patient Objection to Williams Decision
findings.summary: Entry 291 (20 Oct 2021) documents patient complained Williams 'advised to stop taking pregabalin'; patient wanted to continue. Idowu prescribed 50mg BD (100mg/day).
findings.legalSignificance: CORROBORATING EVIDENCE - Third-party GP documentation of: Williams made the decision; Patient was not consulted; Patient objected.

findings.title: Clive Polles Buprenorphine Patch Refusal ~4 Days Pre-Seizure
findings.summary: Practice Manager Clive Polles refused to authorize replacement buprenorphine patch after patient's patch was water-damaged. This occurred approximately 4 days before the 23 Dec 2021 seizure.
findings.evidenceRefs: Patient testimony; F072; GP Records Dec 2021; F367
findings.legalSignificance: DIRECT CAUSATION CONTRIBUTOR - Non-clinical staff refusing medication authorization 4 days before seizure. Combined with pregabalin cessation Oct 2021 and pain clinic rejection.

findings.title: Dr Bhaskar Fabricated 'Neurologist Clearance' of Back Pain
findings.summary: Bhaskar stated: 'The neurologists recently reviewed him and there has not been any concerns raised regarding his back pain.' This is FABRICATED - the only neurologist was Dr Kalladka (Headache Clinic) who NEVER assessed back pain.
findings.evidenceRefs: CL007 Bhaskar letter p.1; Patient testimony re: Dr Kalladka (Headache Clinic only)
findings.legalSignificance: FABRICATION BY SPECIALIST - Consultant invented fictitious specialist clearance in official letter to justify rejecting chronic pain patient without examination.

findings.title: The 'Mathematical Entrapment' (Oramorph)
findings.summary: GPs restricted Oramorph to 20ml/day (15-day supply) despite Pain Clinic authorization for 30ml/day (10-day supply). Created calculated gap where patient ran out on Day 10, allowing false 'addiction' labelling.
findings.legalSignificance: DEVASTATING - Proves 'addiction' narrative based on falsified dosage parameters. Destroys 'Contributory Negligence' defence.

findings.title: Dr Bulale's SMS Admission
findings.summary: Dr Bulale SMS (16/03/2023) explicitly enforcing '15-day' calculation, documenting refusal to adhere to specialist's 60mg/day instruction.
findings.legalSignificance: BREACH - Direct evidence of GP overruling Specialist's pain management plan without clinical justification.

findings.title: Dr Drewry's Negligent Refusal
findings.summary: Dr Drewry refused prescription Day 7 (02/08/2024, weekend cover), citing '15-day' rule, despite current GP and Pain Team having established 10-day clinical need.
findings.legalSignificance: BAD FAITH - 'Addiction' bias persisted and used to deny care even after clinical record corrected.

findings.title: False Statement of 'Normal Imaging' (Dec 2021)
findings.summary: GP noted 'CT head - NAD' but failed to order spinal imaging despite 'C/O severe back pain'. Later narratives falsely imply 'imaging has all been normal' regarding back.
findings.evidenceRefs: GP_Records_2021.md Entry 341 vs Ambulance ePCR F250
findings.legalSignificance: BREACH / FALSE ASSURANCE - Contributed to 10-month fracture diagnosis delay.

findings.title: Failure to Investigate Cauda Equina Red Flags (Dec 2023)
findings.summary: Patient presented with third-degree burn from thermal anaesthesia AND documented saddle symptoms. Dr Drewry failed to investigate cauda equina red flags despite explicit patient request.
findings.legalSignificance: BREACH - Failure to investigate cauda equina constellation.

findings.title: Post-Surgical 'Verbal Warning' Cruelty (Feb 2023)
findings.summary: Patient received 'verbal warning' for seeking pain relief 3 DAYS after major skull surgery (SCDS repair).
findings.legalSignificance: BAD FAITH - Warning during legitimate post-surgical pain management.

findings.title: The 'Somatoform' Trigger Event (Jan 2023)
findings.summary: Somatoform (E278) applied during telephone medication negotiation - NOT psychiatric assessment. Applied AFTER MRI proved T5-T8 fractures.
findings.legalSignificance: BREACH - Confirms F040 with specific trigger context.

findings.title: The 'Invisible' Fractures (Dec 2022)
findings.summary: Dr Ali documented lumbar findings from MRI but OMITTED T5-T8 fractures from same scan. Selective reporting hid injury causing symptoms.
findings.evidenceRefs: GP Records Dec 2022 vs MRI Report 16/10/2022
findings.legalSignificance: SELECTIVE REPORTING - Critical finding omitted from GP documentation.

findings.title: The Mirtazapine 'Refusal' Fabrication (Nov 2022)
findings.summary: GP claimed patient 'refused' Mirtazapine. Pharmacy records prove patient collected and took medication.
findings.evidenceRefs: GP Records Nov 2022; Pharmacy dispensing records
findings.legalSignificance: FABRICATION - False documentation contradicted by pharmacy records.

findings.title: The 'Oct 2021' Historical Distortion (Jul 2022)
findings.summary: GP recorded seizure date as 'Oct 2021' instead of correct 23 Dec 2021. Injury documented as 'chest pain' rather than back pain/fractures.
findings.evidenceRefs: GP Records Jul 2022 vs Ambulance ePCR F250
findings.legalSignificance: FALSIFICATION - Incorrect date and injury characterisation.

findings.title: The 'No Insomnia' Fabrication (Nov 2022)
findings.summary: Dr Ali documented patient 'had no insomnia' - directly contradicted by Jason Parry letter (22/07/2021): 'struggling to sleep as a result of the back pain.'
findings.legalSignificance: FABRICATION - Undermines causation chain (sleep deprivation → seizure).

findings.title: Pregabalin Cliff-Edge and 4-Month Void (Oct 2021 - Feb 2022)
findings.summary: Pregabalin 600mg abruptly stopped violating BNF taper. Token 100mg issued, then NO NHS supply for 4 months. Patient forced to obtain private prescription day of seizure (24/12/2021).
findings.legalSignificance: CAUSATION - 4-month void contributed to seizure risk. Critical for F050 chain.
